706108f.text:
Ocean Ave., east side, at the N.W. corner of Oriental Boulevard, show. ing the entrance to Lloyds Fire Works in front of which was the New York,
Brooklyn and Manhattan Beach R.R.
About 1907.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706108f.folder: Ocean Avenue & Oriental Boulevard, Brooklyn, NY

706144f-b.text:
(1) Oriental Boulevard, south side, west of Ocean Ave., showihg the Manhattan Beach Hotel built by Elbert Snediker in 1877 and owned by Austin Corbin, who opened it on July 18, 1877. The 4-story west wing was added in 1876, and it was again enlarged in 1879, Overall, the hotel was 660 feet long and accomodated 500 people. Its owners or lessees were H.3. Breslin, 1883; Simieon Leland, 1891; T.F. Silleck, 1809-1901; Alfred T. Amer, 1909-1910; and Jeseph P. Greaves, 1911,when iwas demolished in the same year. In 1937 the Manhattan Beach Baths used the site as a parking place for automobiles.

September 20, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, a close up.

September 20, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, looking west

September 20, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, looking east from Brighton Beach, showing the hotel in the distance.

September 20, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706145f-b.text:
(1) Oriental Boulevard, south side, west of Ocean Ave., showing the Manhattan Beach Hotel facing the Atlantic.

September 20, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing a rear view.  It was operated by Majr Burnap in 1880.

September 20, 1911.

703301f.text:
Foraris Trained Wild Animal Arena, Brighton Beach, 50-100' west of the N.W. corner of Oriental Boulevard and Ocean Ave.

(About 1910).

Neg# 3554

706146f-a.text:
Oriental Boulevard, at the S.W. corner of Ocean Ave., showing the realty office of the Manhattan Beach Estates, operated by Joseph P. Day.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
